name: Plotting Pretty Pictures
body:
Better Categorical Axis Support
======================================

It's fairly typical for matplotlib users to need to plot catagorical data:
![picture](http://i.imgur.com/oVMKFEO.png)

And even a graph this simple requires the user to unpack a native intuitive data structure in order to create it:
```
data = {'apples':10, 'oranges':15, 'lemons':5, 'limes':20}
fig = plt.figure()`
ax = fig.add_subplot(1,1,1)`
ax.bar(range(4), data.values(), tick_label=data.keys(), 
       align='center', color='lightgray')
ax.xaxis.set_tick_params(size=0)
```

One of the major aims of this project is to simplify the process so that at the least, the ax.bar call can be reduced to something like `ax.bar(data, align='center', color='lightgray')`

This project aims to encompass more than just bar graphs, and more than just dictionaries; support charts and data structures will determined as the project develops.
